text: Sallustio Pecólo or Sallustio Pecoli (1600 – 7 Jan 1651) was a Roman Catholic prelate who served as Bishop of Venosa (1640–1651). (in Latin)"Bishop Sallustio Pecólo (Pecoli)" Catholic-Hierarchy.org. David M. Cheney. Retrieved July 18, 2016 ==Biography== Sallustio Pecólo was born in Terni, Italy in 1600 and ordained a priest on 28 October 1640. On 3 December 1640, he was appointed during the papacy of Pope Urban VIII as Bishop of Venosa. On 9 December 1640, he was consecrated bishop by Giulio Cesare Sacchetti, Cardinal-Priest of Santa Susanna, with Leonardo Mocenigo, Archbishop of Candia, and Lelio Falconieri, Titular Archbishop of Thebae, serving as co-consecrators. He served as Bishop of Venosa until his resignation on 13 March 1648. He died on 7 January 1651. While bishop, he was the principal co-consecrator of Pietro Paolo Russo, Bishop of Nusco (1649). == References == ==External links and additional sources== * (for Chronology of Bishops) * (for Chronology of Bishops) Category:17th-century Roman Catholic bishops Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Urban VIII Category:1600 births Category:1651 deaths
